transportAdvice: St. John's has a bus system that covers the main urban areas, though service is limited on weekends and evenings. The downtown core and waterfront are very walkable. Taxis are available, and renting a car is recommended for exploring the rugged coastline and outports.

weather.description: Cold and snowy with frequent storms and strong winds; warm winter gear is essential.
Coldest month with heavy snow, ice, and occasional freezing rain.
Late winter conditions persist with a mix of snow and rain as spring slowly approaches.
Spring begins slowly with melting snow and cool, damp conditions; icebergs may be visible off the coast.
Cool spring with fog common along the coast; iceberg season peaks and whale watching begins.
Mild and pleasant with long days and the best chances for iceberg and puffin sightings.
Warmest month with comfortable temperatures, though fog can roll in from the ocean.
Warm and relatively dry, ideal for hiking the East Coast Trail and exploring the coastline.
Early autumn with pleasant temperatures and beautiful coastal scenery as foliage begins to change.
Cooling rapidly with increasing wind and rain; a dramatic time for coastal landscapes.
Cold, wet, and windy as winter approaches; first snowfall typically arrives.
Full winter with snow, ice, and the famous Mummers tradition adding festive charm.
